instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
Hi laptop had liquid spill as is now not seeing/charging the battery. I have reballed the Smc and replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> as I was not getting <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>. Readings on the batt connector are 
pins 1-4 = 4.3v
pin 5 = 3.3v
pin 6 = 3.3 - 0.21v
pin 7 .276 - .019v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
Post diode mode (red probe at ground) on both SCL/SDA lines.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: Hi forgot to mention Sda line was short because of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> so changed that and sda came back up, (both sda/scl .53) I also had Checked current sensing resistors and continuity to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and was good. <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> is ok 10k

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
If battery is not even detected, there is a problem with battery bus.
If you have an o-scope, check for pulses.
If diode mode readings are equals on both lines, then probably bad SMC.
Be aware of battery connector; sometime corrosion underneath can block the bus communication.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: What should pin 7 read ? as it still read pin 7 .276 - .019v even without battery. I have scope there are pulses on sda line.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
Pin 7 must be kept low through <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>; it enables the battery.

You must have pulses on SCL too.
Did you try known good working battery?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: Scl does not pulse that I can see on scope. I dont have another batter to compare unfortunately. And no donor board of same number to try a different SMC.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: Does the Smc have to come from exactly the same board or are some inter-changeable?.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message: Yes has to come from 3662 board

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not charging
threads.message:
ALWAYS use SMC from same donor model.
Sometime board can start with different SMC, but you will get weird issues; only solved by correct SMC.
